contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=February 2013}} '''Leo Niehorster''' (b. February 8, 1947) is the webmaster of ''World War II Armed Forces Orders of Battle and Organizations'' and the author of several books on [[World War II]]. Niehorster has a [[Doctor of Philosophy|Ph.D.]], from [[Columbia Pacific University]], in [[History]]. He has his masters and bachelor's degrees in [[business administration]]. He retired in 2010. Niehorster was born in [[The Hague]], the [[Netherlands]]. He now lives in [[Germany]], and has previously resided in [[Peru]], [[United Kingdom|Britain]], [[Mexico]], [[Canada]], and the [[United States]]. He served in the [[United States Army|US Army]] from 1968 to 1972, including the [[130th Engineer Brigade (United States)|130th Engineer Brigade]], at [[Hanau]], [[Germany]], from 1970 to 1972. == Writings == *''[http://niehorster.orbat.com/000_admin/002_rha/002rha.htm The Royal Hungarian Army 1920--1945: Organization and History]'' *''[http://niehorster.orbat.com/000_admin/002_vols/002vols.htm GERMAN WORLD WAR II Organizational Series]'' *''[http://niehorster.orbat.com/000_admin/002_oob/_oob-intro.html German Army 1939-1945: An Order of Battle]'' *''[http://niehorster.orbat.com/000_admin/002_usa/_usa-main.html The United States Armed Forces Order of Battle – 7 December 1941]'' He is currently working on other books dealing with military history. == External links == * [http://niehorster.orbat.com/index.htm World War II Armed Forces – Orders of Battle and Organizations] {{Authority control|VIAF=60307732}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Niehorster, Leo | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH =8th February 1947 | PLACE OF BIRTH =The Hague, Netherlands | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Niehorster, Leo}} [[Category:1947 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American military historians]] [[Category:People from The Hague]] [[Category:Columbia Pacific University alumni]] [[Category:United States Army personnel]] [[Category:World War II historians]]
